definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Plus students still need money for books, transportation, medical insurance.
sentences.chinese: 学生需另付书费，交通费，医疗保险等。

sentences.english: Other expenses to consider include travel, lodging, and time missed from work.
sentences.chinese: 其它需要考虑的费用包括交通费，住宿费和误工费。

sentences.english: The minimum salary could not even cover the commuter costs.
sentences.chinese: 最低工资甚至不够支付上下班交通费。

sentences.english: It includes all the transportation fare, the ticket fare and the accommodation fare.
sentences.chinese: 它包括所有的交通费，门票费和膳宿费。

sentences.english: So we need charge Bose the transportation fee RMB1500.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们需要收取交通费1500元玻色。

definition: to delay one's work/to be late for or absent from work/loss of working time
to be reimbursed for actual expenses
rent for a room or house
